targets.rawSql: select to_timestamp(timestamp_usecs / 1000000) as time,memory_usage_percent as memory from reporting.resource_usage_stats where entity_type = 1 order by time
select 100 * physical_usage_bytes / cluster_capacity_bytes as percent_full from reporting.cluster
select to_timestamp(timestamp_usecs / 1000000) as time, cpu_usage_percent as CPU from reporting.resource_usage_stats where entity_type = 1 order by time;
select to_timestamp(timestamp_usecs / 1000000) as time,memory_usage_percent as memory from reporting.resource_usage_stats where entity_type = 1 order by time
select to_timestamp(timestamp_usecs / 1000000) as time, cpu_usage_percent as CPU from reporting.resource_usage_stats where entity_type = 1 order by time;

panels.description: Read throughput on the cluster (in MiB)

targets.rawSql: select to_timestamp(timestamp_usecs / 1000000) as time, read_throughput_bytes_per_sec/1048576 as read_throughput_mib from reporting.io_performance_stats where entity_type = 1;

panels.title: Latest Read Throughput (MiB)

panels.description: Write throughput on the cluster (in MiB)

targets.rawSql: select to_timestamp(timestamp_usecs / 1000000) as time, write_throughput_bytes_per_sec/1048576 as write_throughput_mib from reporting.io_performance_stats where entity_type = 1;

panels.title: Latest Write Throughput (MiB)

panels.description: This graph shows the read IOPS over the entire cluster.

targets.rawSql: select to_timestamp(timestamp_usecs / 1000000) as time, read_iops from reporting.io_performance_stats where entity_type = 1 and read_iops <> 0 order by time;

panels.title: Latest Read IOPS

panels.description: This graph shows the write IOPS over the entire cluster.

targets.rawSql: select to_timestamp(timestamp_usecs / 1000000) as time, write_iops from reporting.io_performance_stats where entity_type = 1 and write_iops <> 0 order by time;

panels.title: Latest Write IOPS

panels.description: Non-zero values for Write Latency on the cluster (in milliseconds)

targets.rawSql: select to_timestamp(timestamp_usecs / 1000000) as time, read_latency_msecs from reporting.io_performance_stats where entity_type = 1 and read_latency_msecs <> 0 ORDER BY time

panels.title: Latest Read Latency (ms)

panels.description: Non-zero values for Write Latency on the cluster (in milliseconds)

targets.rawSql: select to_timestamp(timestamp_usecs / 1000000) as time, write_latency_msecs from reporting.io_performance_stats where entity_type = 1  and write_latency_msecs <> 0 ORDER BY time

panels.title: Latest Write Latency (ms)

panels.description: Read throughput on the cluster (in MiB)

targets.rawSql: select to_timestamp(timestamp_usecs / 1000000) as time, read_throughput_bytes_per_sec/1048576 as read_throughput_mib from reporting.io_performance_stats where entity_type = 1;

panels.title: Read Throughput

panels.description: This graph shows the read IOPS over the entire cluster.

targets.rawSql: select to_timestamp(timestamp_usecs / 1000000) as time, read_iops from reporting.io_performance_stats where entity_type = 1 order by time;

panels.title: Read IOPS

panels.description: Non-zero values for Read Latency on the cluster (in milliseconds)

targets.rawSql: select to_timestamp(timestamp_usecs / 1000000) as time, read_latency_msecs from reporting.io_performance_stats where entity_type = 1 ORDER BY time

panels.title: Read Latency

panels.description: Write throughput on the cluster (in MiB)

targets.rawSql: select to_timestamp(timestamp_usecs / 1000000) as time, write_throughput_bytes_per_sec/1048576 as write_throughput_mib from reporting.io_performance_stats where entity_type = 1;

panels.title: Write Throughput

panels.description: This graph shows the write IOPS over the entire cluster.

targets.rawSql: select to_timestamp(timestamp_usecs / 1000000) as time, write_iops from reporting.io_performance_stats where entity_type = 1 order by time;

panels.title: Write IOPS

panels.description: Non-zero values for Write Latency on the cluster (in milliseconds)

targets.rawSql: select to_timestamp(timestamp_usecs / 1000000) as time, write_latency_msecs from reporting.io_performance_stats where entity_type = 1 ORDER BY time

panels.title: Write Latency

targets.rawSql: select view_id, view_name , (logical_usage_bytes/1073741824) as logical_usage_GiB from reporting.views ORDER by logical_usage_bytes DESC;

panels.description: For views assigned a quota, this dashboard lists the usage of each view.

targets.rawSql: select view_name, 100 * logical_usage_bytes / logical_quota_bytes as quota_percent from reporting.views where logical_quota_bytes <> 0;

panels.title: View Quota Consumption
